name: ChunkedConversionSink
comment:
A dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink is used to transmit data more efficiently between two converters during chunked conversions.

The basic ChunkedConversionSink is just a dart-core.Sink, and converters should work with a plain Sink, but may work more efficiently with certain specialized types of ChunkedConversionSink.

It is recommended that implementations of ChunkedConversionSink extends this class, to inherit any further methods that may be added to the class.

add.name: add
add.comment:
Adds chunked data to this sink.

This method is also used when converters are used as dart-convert.StreamTransformers.

close.name: close
close.comment:
Closes the sink.

This signals the end of the chunked conversion. This method is called when converters are used as dart-convert.StreamTransformer's.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

add.name: add
add.comment:
Put the data into the sink.

Must not be called after a call to dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink.close.

close.name: close
close.comment:
Tell the sink that no further data will be added.

Calling this method more than once is allowed, but does nothing.

The dart-convert.ChunkedConversionSink.add method must not be called after this method.
